content:
Well, thanks for the interest, truly, but if you are here then we probably are very much alike.
Soooo, no big surprises here…
I’m John and I’ve worked as both network and voice (UC) engineer my entire career and always for large(r) multinational enterprises. About 1-2 years ago I decided to start moving into the network automation space. So, I started off with learning some Python and scripting some of my daily tasks instead of doing them manually. I also got the Cisco DevNet Associate cert and am working now on the DevNet Professional cert. There is a lot to learn still and the goal is to become an network automation engineer as opposed to a network engineer who writes a bunch of scripts.
So, why this blog then? Fair question. I guess I just want to share. There were many times in my career when I was stuck with a problem and then stumbled upon a blog entry of a fellow engineer who had been facing the very same challenge and then decided to share the solution and therefore saved me from a lot of headache. And I hope that the information I share on this website will be helpful to someone else out there on the interwebs.
title: About
